intro: Cryptantha subretusa, commonly known as the slender cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, dry habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Cryptantha subretusa is an annual species, completing its life cycle within a single growing season.
